00034 %locations
00035 
00036 /* supress shift-reduces conflict message for dangling else */
00037 /* one for 'if', one for 'uif' */
00038 %expect 2
00039 
00040 %pure-parser
00041 
00042 %code requires {
00043 
00044 #define YYLTYPE SourcePos
00045 
00046 # define YYLLOC_DEFAULT(Current, Rhs, N)                               \
00047     do                                                                 \
00048       if (N)                                                           \
00049         {                                                              \
00050           (Current).first_line   = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 1).first_line;       \
00051           (Current).first_column = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 1).first_column;     \
00052           (Current).last_line    = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, N).last_line;        \
00053           (Current).last_column  = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, N).last_column;      \
00054           (Current).name         = YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 1).name    ;         \
00055         }                                                              \
00056       else                                                             \
00057         { /* empty RHS */                                              \
00058           (Current).first_line   = (Current).last_line   =             \
00059             YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 0).last_line;                               \
00060           (Current).first_column = (Current).last_column =             \
00061             YYRHSLOC (Rhs, 0).last_column;                             \
00062           (Current).name = NULL;                        /* new */ \
00063         }                                                              \
00064     while (0)
00065 }

00207 %start translation_unit

00209 
00210 string_constant
00211     : TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL { $$ = new std::string(*yylval.stringVal); }
00212     ;
00213 
00214 primary_expression
00215     : TOKEN_IDENTIFIER {
00216         const char *name = yylval.stringVal->c_str();
00217         Symbol *s = m->symbolTable->LookupVariable(name);
00218         $$ = NULL;
00219         if (s)
00220             $$ = new SymbolExpr(s, @1);       
00221         else {
00222             std::vector<Symbol *> *funs = m->symbolTable->LookupFunction(name);
00223             if (funs)
00224                 $$ = new FunctionSymbolExpr(funs, @1);
00225         }
00226         if ($$ == NULL) {
00227             std::vector<std::string> alternates = 
00228                 m->symbolTable->ClosestVariableOrFunctionMatch(name);
00229             std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
00230             Error(@1, "Undeclared symbol \"%s\".%s", name, alts.c_str());
00231         }
00232     }
00233     | TOKEN_INT32_CONSTANT {
00234         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstInt32, yylval.int32Val, @1); 
00235     }
00236     | TOKEN_UINT32_CONSTANT {
00237         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32, (uint32_t)yylval.int32Val, @1); 
00238     }
00239     | TOKEN_INT64_CONSTANT {
00240         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstInt64, yylval.int64Val, @1); 
00241     }
00242     | TOKEN_UINT64_CONSTANT {
00243         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstUInt64, (uint64_t)yylval.int64Val, @1); 
00244     }
00245     | TOKEN_FLOAT_CONSTANT {
00246         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstFloat, (float)yylval.floatVal, @1); 
00247     }
00248     | TOKEN_TRUE {
00249         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstBool, true, @1);
00250     }
00251     | TOKEN_FALSE {
00252         $$ = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstBool, false, @1);
00253     }
00254 /*    | TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL
00255        { UNIMPLEMENTED }*/
00256     | '(' expression ')' { $$ = $2; }
00257     ;
00258 
00259 postfix_expression
00260     : primary_expression
00261     | postfix_expression '[' expression ']'
00262       { $$ = new IndexExpr($1, $3, @1); }
00263     | postfix_expression '(' ')'
00264       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($1, new ExprList(@1), @1, false); }
00265     | postfix_expression '(' argument_expression_list ')'
00266       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($1, $3, @1, false); }
00267     | TOKEN_LAUNCH '<' postfix_expression '(' argument_expression_list ')' '>'
00268       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($3, $5, @3, true); }
00269     | TOKEN_LAUNCH '<' postfix_expression '(' ')' '>'
00270       { $$ = new FunctionCallExpr($3, new ExprList(@3), @3, true); }
00271     | postfix_expression '.' TOKEN_IDENTIFIER
00272       { $$ = MemberExpr::create($1, yytext, @1, @3); }
00273 /*    | postfix_expression TOKEN_PTR_OP TOKEN_IDENTIFIER
00274       { UNIMPLEMENTED }
00275 */
00276     | postfix_expression TOKEN_INC_OP
00277       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PostInc, $1, @1); }
00278     | postfix_expression TOKEN_DEC_OP
00279       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PostDec, $1, @1); }
00280     ;
00281 
00282 argument_expression_list
00283     : assignment_expression      { $$ = new ExprList($1, @1); }
00284     | argument_expression_list ',' assignment_expression
00285       {
00286           ExprList *argList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>($1);
00287           assert(argList != NULL);
00288           argList->exprs.push_back($3);
00289           $$ = argList;
00290       }
00291     ;
00292 
00293 unary_expression
00294     : postfix_expression
00295     | TOKEN_INC_OP unary_expression   
00296       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PreInc, $2, @2); }
00297     | TOKEN_DEC_OP unary_expression   
00298       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::PreDec, $2, @2); }
00299     | '+' cast_expression 
00300       { $$ = $2; }
00301     | '-' cast_expression 
00302       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::Negate, $2, @2); }
00303     | '~' cast_expression 
00304       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::BitNot, $2, @2); }
00305     | '!' cast_expression 
00306       { $$ = new UnaryExpr(UnaryExpr::LogicalNot, $2, @2); }
00307     ;
00308 
00309 cast_expression
00310     : unary_expression
00311     | '(' type_name ')' cast_expression
00312       {
00313           // If type_name isn't explicitly a varying, We do a GetUniform() 
00314           // call here so that things like:
00315           // uniform int y = ...;
00316           // uniform float x = 1. / (float)y;
00317           // don't issue an error due to (float)y being inadvertently
00318           // and undesirably-to-the-user "varying"...
00319           if ($2 == NULL || $4 == NULL || $4->GetType() == NULL)
00320               $$ = NULL;
00321           else {
00322               if ($4->GetType()->IsUniformType())
00323                  $2 = $2->GetAsUniformType();
00324               $$ = new TypeCastExpr($2, $4, @1); 
00325           }
00326       }
00327     ;
00328 
00329 multiplicative_expression
00330     : cast_expression
00331     | multiplicative_expression '*' cast_expression
00332       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Mul, $1, $3, @2); }
00333     | multiplicative_expression '/' cast_expression
00334       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Div, $1, $3, @2); }
00335     | multiplicative_expression '%' cast_expression
00336       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Mod, $1, $3, @2); }
00337     ;
00338 
00339 additive_expression
00340     : multiplicative_expression
00341     | additive_expression '+' multiplicative_expression
00342       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Add, $1, $3, @2); }
00343     | additive_expression '-' multiplicative_expression
00344       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Sub, $1, $3, @2); }
00345     ;
00346 
00347 shift_expression
00348     : additive_expression
00349     | shift_expression TOKEN_LEFT_OP additive_expression
00350       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Shl, $1, $3, @1); }
00351     | shift_expression TOKEN_RIGHT_OP additive_expression
00352       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Shr, $1, $3, @1); }
00353     ;
00354 
00355 relational_expression
00356     : shift_expression
00357     | relational_expression '<' shift_expression
00358       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Lt, $1, $3, @2); }
00359     | relational_expression '>' shift_expression
00360       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Gt, $1, $3, @2); }
00361     | relational_expression TOKEN_LE_OP shift_expression
00362       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Le, $1, $3, @2); }
00363     | relational_expression TOKEN_GE_OP shift_expression
00364       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Ge, $1, $3, @2); }
00365     ;
00366 
00367 equality_expression
00368     : relational_expression
00369     | equality_expression TOKEN_EQ_OP relational_expression
00370       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Equal, $1, $3, @2); }
00371     | equality_expression TOKEN_NE_OP relational_expression
00372       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, $1, $3, @2); }
00373     ;
00374 
00375 and_expression
00376     : equality_expression
00377     | and_expression '&' equality_expression
00378       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, $1, $3, @2); }
00379     ;
00380 
00381 exclusive_or_expression
00382     : and_expression
00383     | exclusive_or_expression '^' and_expression
00384       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::BitXor, $1, $3, @2); }
00385     ;
00386 
00387 inclusive_or_expression
00388     : exclusive_or_expression
00389     | inclusive_or_expression '|' exclusive_or_expression
00390       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::BitOr, $1, $3, @2); }
00391     ;
00392 
00393 logical_and_expression
00394     : inclusive_or_expression
00395     | logical_and_expression TOKEN_AND_OP inclusive_or_expression
00396       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, $1, $3, @2); }
00397     ;
00398 
00399 logical_or_expression
00400     : logical_and_expression
00401     | logical_or_expression TOKEN_OR_OP logical_and_expression
00402       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, $1, $3, @2); }
00403     ;
00404 
00405 conditional_expression
00406     : logical_or_expression
00407     | logical_or_expression '?' expression ':' conditional_expression
00408       { $$ = new SelectExpr($1, $3, $5, @1); }
00409     ;
00410 
00411 assignment_expression
00412     : conditional_expression
00413     | unary_expression '=' assignment_expression
00414       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::Assign, $1, $3, @2); }
00415     | unary_expression TOKEN_MUL_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00416       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::MulAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00417     | unary_expression TOKEN_DIV_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00418       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::DivAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00419     | unary_expression TOKEN_MOD_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00420       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::ModAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00421     | unary_expression TOKEN_ADD_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00422       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::AddAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00423     | unary_expression TOKEN_SUB_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00424       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::SubAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00425     | unary_expression TOKEN_LEFT_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00426       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::ShlAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00427     | unary_expression TOKEN_RIGHT_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00428       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::ShrAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00429     | unary_expression TOKEN_AND_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00430       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::AndAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00431     | unary_expression TOKEN_XOR_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00432       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::XorAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00433     | unary_expression TOKEN_OR_ASSIGN assignment_expression
00434       { $$ = new AssignExpr(AssignExpr::OrAssign, $1, $3, @2); }
00435     ;
00436 
00437 expression
00438     : assignment_expression
00439     | TOKEN_SYNC 
00440       { $$ = new SyncExpr(@1); }
00441     | expression ',' assignment_expression
00442       { $$ = new BinaryExpr(BinaryExpr::Comma, $1, $3, @2); }
00443     ;
00444 
00445 constant_expression
00446     : conditional_expression
00447     ;
00448 
00449 declaration_statement
00450     : declaration     { $$ = new DeclStmt(@1, $1, m->symbolTable); }
00451     ;
00452 
00453 declaration
00454     : declaration_specifiers ';'
00455       {
00456           $$ = new Declaration($1);
00457       }
00458     | declaration_specifiers init_declarator_list ';'
00459       {
00460           $$ = new Declaration($1, $2);
00461       }
00462     ;
00463 
00464 soa_width_specifier
00465     : TOKEN_SOA '<' int_constant '>'
00466       { $$ = $3; }
00467     ;
00468 
00469 declaration_specifiers
00470     : storage_class_specifier
00471       {
00472           $$ = new DeclSpecs(NULL, $1);
00473       }
00474     | storage_class_specifier declaration_specifiers
00475       {
00476           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00477           if (ds != NULL) {
00478               if (ds->storageClass != SC_NONE)
00479                   Error(@1, "Multiple storage class specifiers in a declaration are illegal. "
00480                         "(Have provided both \"%s\" and \"%s\".)",
00481                         lGetStorageClassString(ds->storageClass),
00482                         lGetStorageClassString($1));
00483               else
00484                   ds->storageClass = $1;
00485           }
00486           $$ = ds;
00487       }
00488     | soa_width_specifier
00489       {
00490           DeclSpecs *ds = new DeclSpecs;
00491           ds->soaWidth = $1;
00492           $$ = ds;
00493       }
00494     | soa_width_specifier declaration_specifiers
00495       {
00496           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00497           if (ds != NULL) {
00498               if (ds->soaWidth != 0)
00499                   Error(@1, "soa<> qualifier supplied multiple times in declaration.");
00500               else
00501                   ds->soaWidth = $1;
00502           }
00503           $$ = ds;
00504       }
00505     | type_specifier
00506       {
00507           $$ = new DeclSpecs($1);
00508       }
00509     | type_specifier '<' int_constant '>'
00510     {
00511           DeclSpecs *ds = new DeclSpecs($1);
00512           ds->vectorSize = $3;
00513           $$ = ds;
00514     }
00515     | type_specifier declaration_specifiers
00516       {
00517           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00518           if (ds != NULL) {
00519               if (ds->baseType != NULL)
00520                   Error(@1, "Multiple types provided for declaration.");
00521               ds->baseType = $1;
00522           }
00523           $$ = ds;
00524       }
00525     | type_qualifier
00526       {
00527           $$ = new DeclSpecs(NULL, SC_NONE, $1);
00528       }
00529     | type_qualifier declaration_specifiers
00530       {
00531           DeclSpecs *ds = (DeclSpecs *)$2;
00532           if (ds != NULL)
00533               ds->typeQualifier |= $1;
00534           $$ = ds;
00535       }
00536     ;
00537 
00538 init_declarator_list
00539     : init_declarator
00540       {
00541           std::vector<Declarator *> *dl = new std::vector<Declarator *>;
00542           dl->push_back($1);
00543           $$ = dl;
00544       }
00545     | init_declarator_list ',' init_declarator
00546       {
00547           std::vector<Declarator *> *dl = (std::vector<Declarator *> *)$1;
00548           if (dl != NULL && $3 != NULL)
00549               dl->push_back($3);
00550           $$ = $1;
00551       }
00552     ;
00553 
00554 init_declarator
00555     : declarator
00556     | declarator '=' initializer 
00557       {
00558           if ($1 != NULL)
00559               $1->initExpr = $3; 
00560           $$ = $1; 
00561       }
00562     ;
00563 
00564 storage_class_specifier
00565     : TOKEN_TYPEDEF { $$ = SC_TYPEDEF; }
00566     | TOKEN_EXTERN { $$ = SC_EXTERN; }
00567     | TOKEN_EXTERN TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL  { 
00568           if (*(yylval.stringVal) != "C")
00569               Error(@2, "String constant \"%s\" illegal after \"extern\" qualifier.  "
00570                     "(Expected \"C\".)", yylval.stringVal->c_str());
00571           $$ = SC_EXTERN_C; 
00572       }
00573     | TOKEN_EXPORT { $$ = SC_EXPORT; }
00574     | TOKEN_STATIC { $$ = SC_STATIC; }
00575     ;
00576 
00577 type_specifier
00578     : atomic_var_type_specifier { $$ = $1; }
00579     | TOKEN_TYPE_NAME
00580       { const Type *t = m->symbolTable->LookupType(yytext); 
00581         assert(t != NULL);
00582         $$ = t;
00583       }
00584     | struct_or_union_specifier { $$ = $1; }
00585     | enum_specifier { $$ = $1; }
00586     ;
00587 
00588 atomic_var_type_specifier
00589     : TOKEN_VOID { $$ = AtomicType::Void; }
00590     | TOKEN_BOOL { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingBool; }
00591     | TOKEN_INT8 { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingInt8; }
00592     | TOKEN_INT16 { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingInt16; }
00593     | TOKEN_INT { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingInt32; }
00594     | TOKEN_FLOAT { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingFloat; }
00595     | TOKEN_DOUBLE { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingDouble; }
00596     | TOKEN_INT64 { $$ = AtomicType::VaryingInt64; }
00597     ;
00598 
00599 short_vec_specifier
00600     : atomic_var_type_specifier '<' int_constant '>'
00601       {
00602         Type* vt = 
00603           new VectorType($1, $3);
00604         $$ = vt;
00605       }
00606     ;
00607 
00608 struct_or_union_name
00609     : TOKEN_IDENTIFIER { $$ = strdup(yytext); }
00610     | TOKEN_TYPE_NAME { $$ = strdup(yytext); }
00611     ;
00612 
00613 struct_or_union_specifier
00614     : struct_or_union struct_or_union_name '{' struct_declaration_list '}' 
00615       { 
00616           std::vector<const Type *> elementTypes;
00617           std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
00618           std::vector<SourcePos> elementPositions;
00619           GetStructTypesNamesPositions(*$4, &elementTypes, &elementNames,
00620                                        &elementPositions);
00621           StructType *st = new StructType($2, elementTypes, elementNames,
00622                                           elementPositions, false, true, @2);
00623           m->symbolTable->AddType($2, st, @2);
00624           $$ = st;
00625       }
00626     | struct_or_union '{' struct_declaration_list '}' 
00627       {
00628           std::vector<const Type *> elementTypes;
00629           std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
00630           std::vector<SourcePos> elementPositions;
00631           GetStructTypesNamesPositions(*$3, &elementTypes, &elementNames,
00632                                        &elementPositions);
00633           $$ = new StructType("", elementTypes, elementNames, elementPositions,
00634                               false, true, @1);
00635       }
00636     | struct_or_union '{' '}' 
00637       {
00638           Error(@1, "Empty struct definitions not allowed."); 
00639       }
00640     | struct_or_union struct_or_union_name '{' '}' 
00641       {
00642           Error(@1, "Empty struct definitions not allowed."); 
00643       }
00644     | struct_or_union struct_or_union_name
00645       { const Type *st = m->symbolTable->LookupType($2); 
00646         if (!st) {
00647             std::vector<std::string> alternates = m->symbolTable->ClosestTypeMatch($2);
00648             std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
00649             Error(@2, "Struct type \"%s\" unknown.%s", $2, alts.c_str());
00650         }
00651         else if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(st) == NULL)
00652             Error(@2, "Type \"%s\" is not a struct type! (%s)", $2,
00653                   st->GetString().c_str());
00654         $$ = st;
00655       }
00656     ;
00657 
00658 struct_or_union
00659     : TOKEN_STRUCT 
00660     ;
00661 
00662 struct_declaration_list
00663     : struct_declaration 
00664       { 
00665           std::vector<StructDeclaration *> *sdl = new std::vector<StructDeclaration *>;
00666           if (sdl != NULL && $1 != NULL)
00667               sdl->push_back($1);
00668           $$ = sdl;
00669       }
00670     | struct_declaration_list struct_declaration 
00671       {
00672           std::vector<StructDeclaration *> *sdl = (std::vector<StructDeclaration *> *)$1;
00673           if (sdl != NULL && $2 != NULL)
00674               sdl->push_back($2);
00675           $$ = $1;
00676       }
00677     ;
00678 
00679 struct_declaration
00680     : specifier_qualifier_list struct_declarator_list ';' 
00681       { $$ = new StructDeclaration($1, $2); }
00682     ;
00683 
00684 specifier_qualifier_list
00685     : type_specifier specifier_qualifier_list
00686     | type_specifier
00687     | short_vec_specifier
00688     | type_qualifier specifier_qualifier_list 
00689     {
00690         if ($2 != NULL) {
00691             if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM)
00692                 $$ = $2->GetAsUniformType();
00693             else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_VARYING)
00694                 $$ = $2->GetAsVaryingType();
00695             else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE)
00696                 $$ = new ReferenceType($2, false);
00697             else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_CONST)
00698                 $$ = $2->GetAsConstType();
00699             else if ($1 == TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED) {
00700                 const Type *t = $2->GetAsUnsignedType();
00701                 if (t)
00702                     $$ = t;
00703                 else {
00704                     Error(@1, "Can't apply \"unsigned\" qualifier to \"%s\" type. Ignoring.",
00705                           $2->GetString().c_str());
00706                     $$ = $2;
00707                 }
00708             } 
00709             else {
00710                 UNIMPLEMENTED;
00711             }
00712         }
00713         else
00714             $$ = NULL;
00715     }
00716 /* K&R--implicit int type--e.g. "static foo" -> foo is an int */
00717 /*    | type_qualifier { UNIMPLEMENTED; }*/
00718     ;
00719 
00720 
00721 struct_declarator_list
00722     : struct_declarator 
00723       {
00724           std::vector<Declarator *> *sdl = new std::vector<Declarator *>;
00725           if ($1 != NULL)
00726               sdl->push_back($1);
00727           $$ = sdl;
00728       }
00729     | struct_declarator_list ',' struct_declarator 
00730       {
00731           std::vector<Declarator *> *sdl = (std::vector<Declarator *> *)$1;
00732           if (sdl != NULL && $3 != NULL)
00733               sdl->push_back($3);
00734           $$ = $1;
00735       }
00736     ;
00737 
00738 struct_declarator
00739     : declarator { $$ = $1; }
00740 /* bitfields
00741     | ':' constant_expression
00742     | declarator ':' constant_expression
00743 */
00744     ;
00745 
00746 enum_identifier
00747     : TOKEN_IDENTIFIER { $$ = strdup(yytext); }
00748 
00749 enum_specifier
00750     : TOKEN_ENUM '{' enumerator_list '}' 
00751       {
00752           if ($3 != NULL) {
00753               EnumType *enumType = new EnumType(@1);
00754 
00755               lFinalizeEnumeratorSymbols(*$3, enumType);
00756               for (unsigned int i = 0; i < $3->size(); ++i)
00757                   m->symbolTable->AddVariable((*$3)[i]);
00758               enumType->SetEnumerators(*$3);
00759               $$ = enumType;
00760           }
00761           else
00762               $$ = NULL;
00763       }
00764     | TOKEN_ENUM enum_identifier '{' enumerator_list '}' 
00765       {
00766           if ($4 != NULL) {
00767               EnumType *enumType = new EnumType($2, $2);
00768               m->symbolTable->AddType($2, enumType, @2);
00769 
00770               lFinalizeEnumeratorSymbols(*$4, enumType);
00771               for (unsigned int i = 0; i < $4->size(); ++i)
00772                   m->symbolTable->AddVariable((*$4)[i]);
00773               enumType->SetEnumerators(*$4);
00774               $$ = enumType;
00775           }
00776           else
00777               $$ = NULL;
00778       }
00779     | TOKEN_ENUM enum_identifier
00780       {
00781           const Type *type = m->symbolTable->LookupType($2);
00782           if (type == NULL) {
00783               std::vector<std::string> alternates = m->symbolTable->ClosestEnumTypeMatch($2);
00784               std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
00785               Error(@2, "Enum type \"%s\" unknown.%s", $2, alts.c_str());
00786               $$ = NULL;
00787           }
00788           else {
00789               const EnumType *enumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type);
00790               if (enumType == NULL) {
00791                   Error(@2, "Type \"%s\" is not an enum type (%s).", $2,
00792                         type->GetString().c_str());
00793                   $$ = NULL;
00794               }
00795               else
00796                   $$ = enumType;
00797           }
00798       }
00799     ;
00800 
00801 enumerator_list
00802     : enumerator 
00803       {
00804           if ($1 == NULL)
00805               $$ = NULL;
00806           else {
00807               std::vector<Symbol *> *el = new std::vector<Symbol *>; 
00808               el->push_back($1);
00809               $$ = el;
00810           }
00811       }
00812     | enumerator_list ',' enumerator
00813       {
00814           if ($1 != NULL && $3 != NULL)
00815               $1->push_back($3);
00816           $$ = $1;
00817       }
00818     ;
00819 
00820 enumerator
00821     : enum_identifier
00822       {
00823           $$ = new Symbol($1, @1);
00824       }
00825     | enum_identifier '=' constant_expression
00826       {
00827           int value;
00828           if ($1 != NULL && $3 != NULL &&
00829               lGetConstantInt($3, &value, @3, "Enumerator value")) {
00830               Symbol *sym = new Symbol($1, @1);
00831               sym->constValue = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32,
00832                                               (uint32_t)value, @3);
00833               $$ = sym;
00834           }
00835           else
00836               $$ = NULL;
00837       }
00838     ;
00839 
00840 type_qualifier
00841     : TOKEN_CONST      { $$ = TYPEQUAL_CONST; }
00842     | TOKEN_UNIFORM    { $$ = TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM; }
00843     | TOKEN_VARYING    { $$ = TYPEQUAL_VARYING; }
00844     | TOKEN_TASK       { $$ = TYPEQUAL_TASK; }
00845     | TOKEN_INLINE     { $$ = TYPEQUAL_INLINE; }
00846     | TOKEN_REFERENCE  { $$ = TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE; }
00847     | TOKEN_UNSIGNED   { $$ = TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED; }
00848     ;
00849 
00850 declarator
00851     : direct_declarator
00852     ;
00853 
00854 int_constant
00855     : TOKEN_INT32_CONSTANT { $$ = yylval.int32Val; }
00856     ;
00857 
00858 direct_declarator
00859     : TOKEN_IDENTIFIER
00860       {
00861           Symbol *sym = new Symbol(yytext, @1);
00862           $$ = new Declarator(sym, @1);
00863       }
00864     | '(' declarator ')' { $$ = $2; }
00865     | direct_declarator '[' constant_expression ']'
00866     {
00867         int size;
00868         if ($1 != NULL && lGetConstantInt($3, &size, @3, "Array dimension")) {
00869             $1->AddArrayDimension(size);
00870             $$ = $1;
00871         }
00872         else
00873             $$ = NULL;
00874     }
00875     | direct_declarator '[' ']'
00876     {
00877         if ($1 != NULL)
00878             $1->AddArrayDimension(-1); // unsized
00879         $$ = $1;
00880     }
00881     | direct_declarator '(' parameter_type_list ')'
00882       {
00883           Declarator *d = (Declarator *)$1;
00884           if (d != NULL) {
00885               d->isFunction = true;
00886               d->functionArgs = $3;
00887           }
00888           $$ = d;
00889       }
00890 /* K&R?   | direct_declarator '(' identifier_list ')' */
00891     | direct_declarator '(' ')'
00892       {
00893           Declarator *d = (Declarator *)$1;
00894           if (d != NULL)
00895               d->isFunction = true;
00896           $$ = d;
00897       }
00898     ;
00899 
00900 
00901 parameter_type_list
00902     : parameter_list { $$ = $1; }
00903     ;
00904 
00905 parameter_list
00906     : parameter_declaration
00907     {
00908         std::vector<Declaration *> *dl = new std::vector<Declaration *>;
00909         if ($1 != NULL)
00910             dl->push_back($1);
00911         $$ = dl;
00912     }
00913     | parameter_list ',' parameter_declaration
00914     {
00915         std::vector<Declaration *> *dl = (std::vector<Declaration *> *)$1;
00916         if (dl == NULL)
00917             // dl may be NULL due to an earlier parse error...
00918             dl = new std::vector<Declaration *>;
00919         if ($3 != NULL)
00920             dl->push_back($3);
00921         $$ = dl;
00922     }
00923     | error
00924     {
00925         std::vector<std::string> builtinTokens;
00926         const char **token = lParamListTokens;
00927         while (*token) {
00928             builtinTokens.push_back(*token);
00929             ++token;
00930         }
00931         std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(yytext, builtinTokens);
00932         std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
00933         Error(@1, "Syntax error--token \"%s\" unknown.%s", yytext, alts.c_str());
00934         $$ = NULL;
00935     }
00936     ;
00937 
00938 parameter_declaration
00939     : declaration_specifiers declarator
00940     {
00941         $$ = new Declaration($1, $2); 
00942     }
00943     | declaration_specifiers declarator '=' initializer
00944     { 
00945         if ($2 != NULL)
00946             $2->initExpr = $4;
00947         $$ = new Declaration($1, $2); 
00948 
00949     }
00950     | declaration_specifiers abstract_declarator
00951     {
00952         UNIMPLEMENTED;
00953     }
00954     | declaration_specifiers
00955     {
00956         $$ = new Declaration($1); 
00957     }
00958     ;
00959 
00960 /* K&R? 
00961 identifier_list
00962     : IDENTIFIER
00963     | identifier_list ',' IDENTIFIER
00964     ;
00965 */
00966 
00967 type_name
00968     : specifier_qualifier_list
00969     | specifier_qualifier_list abstract_declarator
00970     ;
00971 
00972 abstract_declarator
00973 /*    : pointer
00974     | direct_abstract_declarator
00975     | pointer direct_abstract_declarator */
00976     : direct_abstract_declarator { UNIMPLEMENTED; }
00977     ;
00978 
00979 direct_abstract_declarator
00980     : '(' abstract_declarator ')'
00981 /*     | '[' ']' */
00982     | '[' constant_expression ']'
00983 /*    | direct_abstract_declarator '[' ']' */
00984     | direct_abstract_declarator '[' constant_expression ']'
00985     | '(' ')'
00986     | '(' parameter_type_list ')'
00987     | direct_abstract_declarator '(' ')'
00988     | direct_abstract_declarator '(' parameter_type_list ')'
00989     ;
00990 
00991 initializer
00992     : assignment_expression
00993     | '{' initializer_list '}' { $$ = $2; }
00994     | '{' initializer_list ',' '}' { $$ = $2; }
00995     ;
00996 
00997 initializer_list
00998     : initializer
00999       { $$ = new ExprList($1, @1); }
01000     | initializer_list ',' initializer
01001       {
01002           if ($1 == NULL)
01003               $$ = NULL;
01004           else {
01005               ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>($1);
01006               assert(exprList);
01007               exprList->exprs.push_back($3);
01008               $$ = exprList;
01009           }
01010       }
01011     ;
01012 
01013 statement
01014     : labeled_statement
01015     | compound_statement
01016     | expression_statement
01017     | selection_statement
01018     | iteration_statement
01019     | jump_statement
01020     | declaration_statement
01021     | print_statement
01022     | error
01023     {
01024         std::vector<std::string> builtinTokens;
01025         const char **token = lBuiltinTokens;
01026         while (*token) {
01027             builtinTokens.push_back(*token);
01028             ++token;
01029         }
01030         std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(yytext, builtinTokens);
01031         std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
01032         Error(@1, "Syntax error--token \"%s\" unknown.%s", yytext, alts.c_str());
01033         $$ = NULL;
01034     }
01035     ;
01036 
01037 labeled_statement
01038     : TOKEN_CASE constant_expression ':' statement
01039       { UNIMPLEMENTED; }
01040     | TOKEN_DEFAULT ':' statement
01041       { UNIMPLEMENTED; }
01042     ;
01043 
01044 start_scope
01045     : '{' { m->symbolTable->PushScope(); }
01046     ;
01047 
01048 end_scope
01049     : '}' { m->symbolTable->PopScope(); }
01050     ;
01051 
01052 compound_statement
01053     : '{' '}' { $$ = NULL; }
01054     | start_scope statement_list end_scope { $$ = $2; }
01055     ;
01056 
01057 statement_list
01058     : statement
01059       {
01060           StmtList *sl = new StmtList(@1);
01061           sl->Add($1);
01062           $$ = sl;
01063       }
01064     | statement_list statement
01065       {
01066           if ($1 != NULL)
01067               ((StmtList *)$1)->Add($2);
01068           $$ = $1;
01069       }
01070     ;
01071 
01072 expression_statement
01073     : ';' { $$ = NULL; }
01074     | expression ';' { $$ = new ExprStmt($1, @1); }
01075     ;
01076 
01077 selection_statement
01078     : TOKEN_IF '(' expression ')' statement
01079       { $$ = new IfStmt($3, $5, NULL, false, @1); }
01080     | TOKEN_IF '(' expression ')' statement TOKEN_ELSE statement
01081       { $$ = new IfStmt($3, $5, $7, false, @1); }
01082     | TOKEN_CIF '(' expression ')' statement
01083       { $$ = new IfStmt($3, $5, NULL, true, @1); }
01084     | TOKEN_CIF '(' expression ')' statement TOKEN_ELSE statement
01085       { $$ = new IfStmt($3, $5, $7, true, @1); }
01086     | TOKEN_SWITCH '(' expression ')' statement
01087       { UNIMPLEMENTED; }
01088     ;
01089 
01090 for_test
01091     : ';'
01092       { $$ = NULL; }
01093     | expression ';'
01094       { $$ = $1; }
01095     ;
01096 
01097 for_init_statement
01098     : expression_statement
01099     | declaration_statement
01100     ;
01101 
01102 for_scope
01103     : TOKEN_FOR { m->symbolTable->PushScope(); }
01104     ;
01105 
01106 cfor_scope
01107     : TOKEN_CFOR { m->symbolTable->PushScope(); }
01108     ;
01109 
01110 iteration_statement
01111     : TOKEN_WHILE '(' expression ')' statement
01112       { $$ = new ForStmt(NULL, $3, NULL, $5, false, @1); }
01113     | TOKEN_CWHILE '(' expression ')' statement
01114       { $$ = new ForStmt(NULL, $3, NULL, $5, true, @1); }
01115     | TOKEN_DO statement TOKEN_WHILE '(' expression ')' ';'
01116       { $$ = new DoStmt($5, $2, false, @1); }
01117     | TOKEN_CDO statement TOKEN_WHILE '(' expression ')' ';'
01118       { $$ = new DoStmt($5, $2, true, @1); }
01119     | for_scope '(' for_init_statement for_test ')' statement
01120       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, NULL, $6, false, @1); 
01121         m->symbolTable->PopScope();
01122       }
01123     | for_scope '(' for_init_statement for_test expression ')' statement
01124       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, new ExprStmt($5, @5), $7, false, @1); 
01125         m->symbolTable->PopScope();
01126       }
01127     | cfor_scope '(' for_init_statement for_test ')' statement
01128       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, NULL, $6, true, @1);
01129         m->symbolTable->PopScope();
01130       }
01131     | cfor_scope '(' for_init_statement for_test expression ')' statement
01132       { $$ = new ForStmt($3, $4, new ExprStmt($5, @5), $7, true, @1);
01133         m->symbolTable->PopScope();
01134       }
01135     ;
01136 
01137 jump_statement
01138     : TOKEN_GOTO TOKEN_IDENTIFIER ';'
01139       { UNIMPLEMENTED; }
01140     | TOKEN_CONTINUE ';'
01141       { $$ = new ContinueStmt(false, @1); }
01142     | TOKEN_BREAK ';'
01143       { $$ = new BreakStmt(false, @1); }
01144     | TOKEN_RETURN ';'
01145       { $$ = new ReturnStmt(NULL, false, @1); }
01146     | TOKEN_RETURN expression ';'
01147       { $$ = new ReturnStmt($2, false, @1); }
01148     | TOKEN_CCONTINUE ';'
01149       { $$ = new ContinueStmt(true, @1); }
01150     | TOKEN_CBREAK ';'
01151       { $$ = new BreakStmt(true, @1); }
01152     | TOKEN_CRETURN ';'
01153       { $$ = new ReturnStmt(NULL, true, @1); }
01154     | TOKEN_CRETURN expression ';'
01155       { $$ = new ReturnStmt($2, true, @1); }
01156     ;
01157 
01158 print_statement
01159     : TOKEN_PRINT '(' string_constant ')'
01160       {
01161            $$ = new PrintStmt(*$3, NULL, @1); 
01162       }
01163     | TOKEN_PRINT '(' string_constant ',' argument_expression_list ')'
01164       {
01165            $$ = new PrintStmt(*$3, $5, @1); 
01166       }
01167     ;
01168 
01169 translation_unit
01170     : external_declaration
01171     | translation_unit external_declaration
01172     | error
01173     {
01174         std::vector<std::string> builtinTokens;
01175         const char **token = lBuiltinTokens;
01176         while (*token) {
01177             builtinTokens.push_back(*token);
01178             ++token;
01179         }
01180         std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(yytext, builtinTokens);
01181         std::string alts = lGetAlternates(alternates);
01182         Error(@1, "Syntax error--token \"%s\" unknown.%s", yytext, alts.c_str());
01183     }
01184     ;
01185 
01186 external_declaration
01187     : function_definition
01188     | TOKEN_EXTERN TOKEN_STRING_LITERAL '{' declaration '}' // FIXME: make sure string=="C"
01189     | declaration 
01190     { 
01191         if ($1 != NULL)
01192             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < $1->declarators.size(); ++i)
01193                 m->AddGlobal($1->declSpecs, $1->declarators[i]);
01194     }
01195     ;
01196 
01197 function_definition
01198     : declaration_specifiers declarator 
01199     {
01200         m->AddGlobal($1, $2);
01201         lAddFunctionParams($2); 
01202         lAddMaskToSymbolTable(@2);
01203         if ($1->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_TASK)
01204             lAddThreadIndexCountToSymbolTable(@2);
01205     } 
01206     compound_statement
01207     {
01208         m->AddFunction($1, $2, $4);
01209         m->symbolTable->PopScope(); // push in lAddFunctionParams();
01210     }
01211 /* function with no declared return type??
01212 func(...) 
01213     | declarator { lAddFunctionParams($1); } compound_statement
01214     {
01215         m->AddFunction(new DeclSpecs(, $1, $3);
01216         m->symbolTable->PopScope(); // push in lAddFunctionParams();
01217     }
01218 */
01219     ;
01220 
01221 %%
01222 
01223 
01224 /** We're about to start parsing the body of a function; add all of the
01225     parameters to the symbol table so that they're available.
01226 */
01227 static void
01228 lAddFunctionParams(Declarator *decl) {
01229     m->symbolTable->PushScope();
01230 
01231     // wire up arguments
01232     if (decl->functionArgs) {
01233         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < decl->functionArgs->size(); ++i) {
01234             Declaration *pdecl = (*decl->functionArgs)[i];
01235             if (pdecl == NULL)
01236                 continue;
01237             assert(pdecl->declarators.size() == 1);
01238             Symbol *sym = pdecl->declarators[0]->sym;
01239 #ifndef NDEBUG
01240             bool ok = m->symbolTable->AddVariable(sym);
01241             assert(ok); // or error message?
01242 #else
01243             m->symbolTable->AddVariable(sym);
01244 #endif
01245         }
01246     }
01247 
01248     // The corresponding pop scope happens in function_definition rules
01249     // above...
01250 }
01251 
01252 
01253 /** Add a symbol for the built-in mask variable to the symbol table */
01254 static void lAddMaskToSymbolTable(SourcePos pos) {
01255     const Type *t = AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32;
01256     Symbol *maskSymbol = new Symbol("__mask", pos, t);
01257     m->symbolTable->AddVariable(maskSymbol);
01258 }
01259 
01260 
01261 /** Add the thread index and thread count variables to the symbol table
01262     (this should only be done for 'task'-qualified functions. */
01263 static void lAddThreadIndexCountToSymbolTable(SourcePos pos) {
01264     Symbol *threadIndexSym = new Symbol("threadIndex", pos, AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32);
01265     m->symbolTable->AddVariable(threadIndexSym);
01266 
01267     Symbol *threadCountSym = new Symbol("threadCount", pos, AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32);
01268     m->symbolTable->AddVariable(threadCountSym);
01269 }

01271 
01272 /** Small utility routine to construct a string for error messages that
01273     suggests alternate tokens for possibly-misspelled ones... */
01274 static std::string lGetAlternates(std::vector<std::string> &alternates) {
01275     std::string alts;
01276     if (alternates.size()) {
01277         alts += " Did you mean ";
01278         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < alternates.size(); ++i) {
01279             alts += std::string("\"") + alternates[i] + std::string("\"");
01280             if (i < alternates.size() - 1) alts += ", or ";
01281         }
01282         alts += "?";
01283     }
01284     return alts;
01285 }
01286 
01287 static const char *
01288 lGetStorageClassString(StorageClass sc) {
01289     switch (sc) {
01290     case SC_NONE:
01291         return "";
01292     case SC_EXTERN:
01293         return "extern";
01294     case SC_EXPORT:
01295         return "export";
01296     case SC_STATIC:
01297         return "static";
01298     case SC_TYPEDEF:
01299         return "typedef";
01300     case SC_EXTERN_C:
01301         return "extern \"C\"";
01302     default:
01303         assert(!"logic error in lGetStorageClassString()");
01304         return "";
01305     }
01306 }
01307 
01308 
01309 /** Given an expression, see if it is equal to a compile-time constant
01310     integer value.  If so, return true and return the value in *value.
01311     If the expression isn't a compile-time constant or isn't an integer
01312     type, return false.
01313 */
01314 static bool
01315 lGetConstantInt(Expr *expr, int *value, SourcePos pos, const char *usage) {
01316     if (expr == NULL)
01317         return false;
01318     expr = expr->TypeCheck();
01319     if (expr == NULL)
01320         return false;
01321     expr = expr->Optimize();
01322     if (expr == NULL)
01323         return false;
01324 
01325     llvm::Constant *cval = expr->GetConstant(expr->GetType());
01326     if (cval == NULL) {
01327         Error(pos, "%s must be a compile-time constant.", usage);
01328         return false;
01329     }
01330     else {
01331         llvm::ConstantInt *ci = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(cval);
01332         if (ci == NULL) {
01333             Error(pos, "%s must be a compile-time integer constant.", usage);
01334             return false;
01335         }
01336         *value = (int)ci->getZExtValue();
01337         return true;
01338     }
01339 }
01340 
01341 
01342 /** Given an array of enumerator symbols, make sure each of them has a
01343     ConstExpr * in their Symbol::constValue member that stores their 
01344     unsigned integer value.  Symbols that had values explicitly provided
01345     in the source file will already have ConstExpr * set; we just need
01346     to set the values for the others here.
01347 */
01348 static void
01349 lFinalizeEnumeratorSymbols(std::vector<Symbol *> &enums, 
01350                            const EnumType *enumType) {
01351     enumType = enumType->GetAsConstType();
01352     enumType = enumType->GetAsUniformType();
01353 
01354     /* nextVal tracks the value for the next enumerant.  It starts from
01355        zero and goes up with each successive enumerant.  If any of them
01356        has a value specified, then nextVal is ignored for that one and is
01357        set to one plus that one's value for the default value for the next
01358        one. */
01359     uint32_t nextVal = 0;
01360 
01361     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < enums.size(); ++i) {
01362         enums[i]->type = enumType;
01363         if (enums[i]->constValue != NULL) {
01364             /* Already has a value, so first update nextVal with it. */
01365             int count = enums[i]->constValue->AsUInt32(&nextVal);
01366             assert(count == 1);
01367             ++nextVal;
01368 
01369             /* When the source file as being parsed, the ConstExpr for any
01370                enumerant with a specified value was set to have unsigned
01371                int32 type, since we haven't created the parent EnumType
01372                by then.  Therefore, add a little type cast from uint32 to
01373                the actual enum type here and optimize it, which will have
01374                us end up with a ConstExpr with the desired EnumType... */
01375             Expr *castExpr = new TypeCastExpr(enumType, enums[i]->constValue,
01376                                               enums[i]->pos);
01377             castExpr = castExpr->Optimize();
01378             enums[i]->constValue = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(castExpr);
01379             assert(enums[i]->constValue != NULL);
01380         }
01381         else {
01382             enums[i]->constValue = new ConstExpr(enumType, nextVal++, 
01383                                                  enums[i]->pos);
01384         }
01385     }
01386 }
Generated on Sat Sep 3 2011 07:15:46 for Intel SPMD Program Compiler by  1.7.2
